post_body:
https://preview.redd.it/0zl81rnr7p4e1.png?width=1870&format=png&auto=webp&s=1c947f7ddcc050ba22a632331b4f35ec599fa603

I'm sorry and ignore the team names, it's a joke. 

I've watched all the videos and comments on various forums and groups on the game.

There are commenters and youtubers as well as just random players (with different ranks). Highlighted the hltv rankings, just for the sake of it.

ps sorry for English, it's not my native language
comments: what is this
Wiser to guarantee a 3-0 with navi vita or gamble for both with g2 navi?
overthinking
I always just looked at what other people were picking and took the arithmetic average to make my bets, and it's a calculation of all this stuff
i understand mate but make it look simple I can barely understand the table can you explain a little
If you take the average of random people’s bets, you will likely end up average too which is 4/10

I called in and wrote out all the player selections:

2 points I gave for a clean 3-0

1 point for advancing to the next set.

\-1 for going 0-3.

By doing so, I sorted the priority of other players' selections by the total of those points, and wrote them out at the end of the list. To make it easier to see the strongest and weakest player choices, I colored the table in ascending order of points. Green is the strongest team, red is the weakest team

3-0: navi, vita

3-1/3-2: g2, faze, spirit, mouz, mongolz, liq

0-3: mibr, wildcard

am i right?

If you consider the majority opinion, yes. But I had a sample of what is found on youtube and in chat rooms, and there are not even 75 people for a proper mathematical sample, but yes, you have understood the principle of this table correctly.
I do understand that you can't add all of the data present in the world what you had as sample you used it it is quite good kudos

post_title: Crowd help during tournament?
post_body: Since the crowd can see minimap and xray, and the pros are sitting face to face with crowd, aren't there tells that the crowd can give pros to hint at what's going on especially during slow quiet rounds? For example people getting more excited can tell you someone will walk around the corner soon.
comments:
There usually are some basic measures, like noise cancelling booths or headphones. However you can still feel the vibrations from the arena.

There are some iconic clips of players abusing the crowd (most commonly they aim their crosshair trough a wall to see if they get a reaction from a crowd). However pros over the years have talked about more tricks in arena, for example if you throw an HE and you hear the explosion in arena, it means you probably naded someone, as the observer deemed it important to observe the HE.

These are the things that come with the arena environment, there is no real way to fix them.

There also been instances of crowd cheating really badly, if its individuals they usually get kicked from the venue, if its on a larger scale, there have been events where minimap and Xray was disabled in the arena.

This has been a thing with in-person events for many, many years. Organizers can do what they can to minimize it by turning off x-ray in person sometimes, noise canceling headphones over IEMs for players, etc, but it’s still going to happen. All pros understand this and expect this. Also, to quote Fl0m, information like that works both ways. 


Some places are worse, for sure. But there’s only so much you can do. You can also still hear the roar of the crowd with sound proof booths iirc.


I hate saying this 
But “it is what it is.”

I’m open to any suggestions to this problem to solve it, but I’m afraid that it’s just not something that can happen. Collective effervescence is a powerful thing.
First time watching a major huh lol

Maybe they can hire some engineers to create a booth that has better noise and vibration insulation from the crowd, and also one way glass that can see in but not out of. I feel like for a information and reading game like CS the pros should be more isolated from crowd cues than they are currently.
Unfortunately I don't think there is a way to solve it. If you isolate the crowd too much, it will just become a studio LAN for the players.

I think it's not big enough of an issue for organizers to invest in the engineering required to really isolate pros from crowd, it costs money. But from my view trying to make a really good vibration and noise booth and one way glass can make tournament games much higher quality from competitive integrity standpoint, while the crowd can still be close to the pros and see them through the glass. This probably isn't necessary for games like Dota 2 or League of legends or whatever but for CS, I feel like it's a worth it investment.

No, in my opinion if I were playing I would take advantage of crowd cues to make slight changes in my gameplay during the round. Valve can be strict for example with coaches not even talking outside of timeouts, in theory they might also be strict about player exposure to crowd during round.

I've already mentioned it in the other comment - isolating the crowd too much will have a negative impact, turning the event into a studio LAN.

Winning in arena is huge test for teams (look at MOUZ). Some players crumble under the pressure of playing in front of thousands of fans. Some players enjoy riding the energy coming from the crowd.

Yes sometimes crowd helps a team, but usually these moments are far and between to cause any major impact on the outcame of matches.

I don't remember what tournament it was, maybe cologne or something, but pros had a glass that was fogged during the round but would unfog between rounds so the pros can emote to each other. Maybe let the crowd always see into the glass, but the pros can only see out of the glass when the round is not active. Not sure if this technology is available but I would assume it is at this point.

  
This would keep the interactive element of the tournament while also helping competitive integrity.

Blast has done this a few times, but even this is an imperfect solution if your goal is to make it so players get 0 external cues. Xyp9x at one point mentioned in an interview that he could tell that enemies were getting hit by his grenade by the fact that the stage vibrated, since that meant the observers had focused on the players getting hit by the grenade.

Obviously we should be fighting against crowd cheating (that being intentional information gain from the crowd, e.g. by having people set up in the crowd to give cues), but the whole point of playing in front of the crowd is the added pressure - if you don't even notice the crowd is there, what's the point of the crowd?  
And the other way too, what's the point of paying good money to be in the crowd if the players are sealed away and may as well be playing in a studio?

Why would I pay hundreds of bucks to cheer for a team that can't hear, see, or feel me cheer?

From a competitive integrity standpoint, duh, we'd have the players locked up in separate rooms with no means of communication with the outside world, but at the end of the day esports isn't just a competition - it's also a product. And a part of the product's appeal is fan interaction, fan participation.

Idk about the viability of having glass be fogged only one way - I feel like it's not doable, because while having the glass be opaque sometimes and transparent other times is very doable, having it be opaque *one way* sometimes and transparent the rest feels like it'd be far more complicated.

Yes, I understand 100% perfection may be impossible but I think it's not good for them to simply just slap on headphones and call it a day. I think maybe if audio cues are too hard to engineer away, perhaps a visual blocker, say a one way glass that rolls up during rounds and rolls back down between rounds, would at least show an effort that valve is thinking about \[visual\] crowd cues that might impact how the round plays.

Edit, I mean, even one single person holding their hand up to their mouth at a specific time can mean the difference between you choosing not to peek this, for example, bomb defusable fake or no fake, or peeking it, or a potential awp angle, or whatever, and so on.

post_title: How are players able to TK instantly at the beginning of a round and not get kicked?
post_body: As a mainly nuke player I see this pretty consistently. Sometimes they get autokicked for team damage close to round start, sometimes they dont?
comments:
Its a bug as old as time, instantly team killing in the first tick of a round doesn't get you immediately banned even in CSGO. As far as I know in CS2 they broke it a little more and you have a bit more time than just "first tick" to TK without instant penalty.

However I think that only applies to the first time you do it, if you try to do it a second time you get immediately banned.

post_title: Mongolz were two cuts above the competition
post_body:
https://preview.redd.it/mue8whlvlm4e1.png?width=1920&format=png&auto=webp&s=652fd32ae2f35df33b4b00988b1a09f602c613d0

  
Don't want to harp on statistics too much given my middling degree of formal training in it but I don't see a world where this isn't of the most dominant runs among supposedly evenly matched opposition in recent memory. They've got multiple representatives in nearly every category that tracks values per round rather than total and are sweeping some of them outright. Safe to say that if there is a team that had no business being in this Opening Stage and a team from here that can make a semi-final run it's these five. Beating a dying horse to a degree but scary stuff nonetheless.
comments: [deleted]

They were certainly clinical about this. You should expect that from a team ranked this high in this draw, but that hasn't stopped top teams from choking in the past, so it's a good sign.

Keeping up the good form after winning Thunderpick (10-match winning streak now).

I have them 3-0 in the next stage. Call me naive, but homestage and form makes me a believer. If they beat G2 in the bo1 and catch the momentum anything is possible.

I'm a mongolz believer
Two of those teams qualified to the next stage. Might not be the best competition in the world, but evidently they were better than most of the other teams.
And they're gonna give every team in that bracket a run for their money when the time comes.
I went 3-1 for both assuming MongolZ win the head-to-head so seems fair to me.
I remember this comment being downvoted, and the parent comment... existing. Typical reddit experience 😁
Guess I was too cautious, jeez.

I can't lie there is a degree of vindication going on but primarily I'm just aggrieved I ultimately relented on giving MongolZ one of my 3-0 spots. It was between them and Mouz.
Just seemed too outlandish for them to reliably win a BO3 against the other, safer 2-0 candidates but here we are.
Semi-finals are now very much in the cards for them.

post_title: Yesterday, moses scolded VP's Jame and electronic for not coming out for a post-match interview. However, Jame did come out for an interview.
post_body:
As a VP and, particularly, a Jame fan, I wanted to break these, in my opinion, unfair allegations. I mean, they would be fair had Jame not actually agreed for the interview, but he did, and that fact went over the ears of the English broadcast viewers.

I respect Jame for many things, he's an extremely nice person with a really stoic and calm view on how things work. He's honest and have never been caught lying. He had said that he doesn't come out for the interviews for mainly two reasons: the first is that his English is still not perfect, even though he improved in it; the second is that he doesn't think coming out for an interview without having to say anything in value makes a lot of sense, both for himself and for the viewers who crave the ultimate answer to the everlasting 'what went wrong' and 'who's at fault' questions.

[Post-match interview on the Chinese stream \(Source: PWRDEsports2 latest VOD @ 9:36:45\)](https://preview.redd.it/ad3smkr42l4e1.png?width=1920&format=png&auto=webp&s=fea92144cc30878d6f6d4bd70aea6b3b8c1d5765)

The interview itself was conducted in Chinese with a Russian translator, so I felt like I owe you all an English translation of it.

Interviewer: It's a pity that you didn't win the match after getting the first map. Can you talk about that with us?

Jame: Yes, of course. Yeah.

Interviewer: Can you talk about that? I mean, what are your thoughts currently?

Jame: Well, they were simply better than us on Inferno today. They had a better planning, better ideas, we couldn't outaim them in the duels that were favorable for us. It's the same as always, we lost because we were weaker.

Interviewer: In Copenhagen, you reached finals \[sic\], but here at the Shanghai Major you're out at this stage already. Is this acceptable for you?

Jame: Obviously not. The team has bigger ambitions. We didn't put all this time into practice just to get eliminated at this stage. It is very sad that all your effort doesn't always lead you to success in sport.

[\\"The changes are likely\\" - Jame](https://preview.redd.it/uy1xfs1n4l4e1.png?width=1331&format=png&auto=webp&s=328b3848741a9eee497a9fee201af6dac3ac7d47)

Inteviewer: You changed two coaches, do you now plan on changing the tactic?

Jame: We still don't know what are we going to do, but the changes are likely. Everything suggests that there will be some. The last season was tough for every player.

Interviewer: Do you miss the Rio Major times? What should it take for you to come back to that state?

Jame: You have to dedicate your entire life to this game and hope that the dispersion of the game won't win over you. One day, you'll win.

Interviewer: Will we see you at the next Major?

Jame: I hope so. I really hope so. We'll do everything it takes.

I know moses probably didn't know about it, as did many other people here, but Jame never ran away from the interview, as many suggested. I initially myself agreed with moses and thought that it was indeed weird that n0rb3r7 was the one who was selected for the interview at such troubled times, but I feel like we all rushed to the conclusions too quickly.
comments: I assume pgl had a side interview off stage? And pw the main interview on stage?
W post

At the moment after the game I didn't know Jame was doing an interview with Perfect world for the Chinese stream. We don't have that information or level of communication, and I'll be honest - having the English stream as kind of the secondary/ancillary priority at an event is a new experience especially as we're on the other side of the world. So my fault on that.

This frustration has been building all year. We've been frequently denied access to certain VP players at events and at times been asked not to discuss VP's leadership situation at all on broadcast. 

I want to know the difficulties they are having so I can tell the story and understand why their play has been disappointing, not to point blame at anyone. I want to be able to frame their failures as a result of the difficulties they are going through.. or if they had been more successful frame wins around the obstacles they had to overcome. 

This wasn't in any way personal against either Jame or electronic - I have great respect for the work players put in- or even at VP. I had this same issue with astralis/device/blamef at the last major. The leadership gets credit when they succeed, and should certainly step up when they fail.

Respect to Jame for doing the interview after what had to be a devastating loss and I'll figure out a way to apologize to him when I get the time
He himself clarified this in a comment in that thread so hopefully he reads this thread well

It just looks unfortunate Moses wasn't told/aware that Jame was doing one on stage

To back up moses a little. VP usually have n0rb3r7 do the interviews a lot. 

electroNic english is fine, he's the other big name on the team

After last Major's incident that happened with Jame and how he handled it, I don't think we criticise his personality. He doesn't shy away from responsibility and doesn't blame others for their loss. He earned a lot of respect from the community and Moses critising him without actually researching is bad on his part.
And of course, a post like this will only get a fraction of attention compared to the one where Jame was flamed

Like I said in the other thread about it, I do agree with Moses that leaders should show leadership, but there could be many explanations why Jame wasn't there. Language barrier being one of them, and then of course this, that he was simply busy elsewhere. 

Thanks for the translation. Always good to hear from Jame.
This is not gonna get noticed enough because it's cool to hate on Jame and VP

He'll come back strong.
Moses isn't very friendly to those penis' he isn't sucking on
So I guess it was entitlement from Moses?
Alright time to SLAM moses, who's with me :^)

Man these interviews are worthless.

"Why did you lose?"
"They played better"
"What are you going to do?"
"Keep trying to be better"

Yeah thanks for the insight

Good on Jame for speaking after the loss, but the responsibility of a leader should be to take the tough interviews - be it him or electronic - to speak to where the team is at after a loss like this. These guys are the leaders of the team and their most experienced players but we barely hear from them. 

Doing the softball interview in front of the Chinese crowd where your words are being translated is a cop out vs talking to the official broadcast where the vast majority of fans and the media are tuning in.
Who cares, the team is dead either way.
He said it just straight out after norbert's interview, how is he supposed to know that jame will also give an interview after

Yes, that was what happened. Jame immediately came out on stage in front of the Chinese fans and spoke with the host, n0rb3r7 was taken backstage by James Banks and interviewed there for the English broadcast. I assume this was done by Perfect World because Chinese fans would obviously be more excited to see Jame speak to them, PGL had no choice but to grab n0rb3r7 and have him speak out.

comments: Complexity fans: are you really surprised?
Grim was playing so scared and Floppy taking some questionable positions on map 3, you can't get more Col than this, Halzerk is the reason the scoreline even look close
Do the Germans have a word for when you're unsurprised but still disappointed?
Seeing floppy standing on top of the box while getting hit by both tuns and outside B physically hurt my soul.

1.83 rating on d2 and still lose 
I genuinely can't anymore
Nice knowing ya flop

end of an era, this is definitely the last time we see ELIGE in a COL jersey.

Also, time to bench Grim or Floppy cause holy fucking shit.

If anyone can find Floppy, please let literally anyone know

CoL getting all the way here just to lose on the last map because Floppy and Grim both disappear is just another data point to go with all the other ones to date. Likely the last time we see this roster.
At least they still get to play in the next stage after it was ripped from them
Justice for BiG! Would have been an awful feeling if they didn’t make it to the next stage after going 3-0 in the RMR.
Welp, pickems are officially dead now, and CoL lets me down for the millionth time.
Hallzerk got the same amount of kills on d2 as floppy did all series.

JAAAAAAAAAA! BIG basically only went against high ranked teams to regain their Legends Spot and im not sure how far they can take this but for now im just proud of them. So happy to not be heartbroken for once.
Congratz to BIG, totally deserved! Especially after the RMR Scam!

rigoN copped a lot of crap yesterday for underperforming as anchor but he sure outclassed floppy in every way today, and krimbo remains as the future and present of German CS what a guy

This is curtains for at least some of CoL, if Elige leaves can Complexity ever find themselves in that 1B spot that they used to hold? something to watch carefully
floppy is dogshit

kick floppy immediately. this is unconscionable
Christ Hallzerk was dragging that Col team kicking and screaming to round wins. He didn't even have the usual "Hits screamers, misses sitters" moments on Dust 2 and Anubis. He was hitting shots.

nt hallzerk

rigon’s mental strength needs to be studied

krimbo won like 5 game defining clutches on dust 2 what the hell
